Black Sabbath, a band I like, is a cautionary tale band, I don't know if he listened to them. Now if he name dropped some other bands that were inspired by the Satanic Panic from the later 70's early 80's I might feel this song was better. I mean if he had said he had been raised on the Beatles, a band I like, I would take it more seriously as causing harm. I also feel that his alliteration in the song is a little predictable. The line "I feel it in my bones and coursing through my veins" I believe it would have been better to mix it up with, " I feel it coursing through my veins and rattling my bones". One for the meter of the rhyme and for the line up of the later rhyme. Otherwise this artist/ band is pretty good and with time his craft will only get better. I can only hope that he won't burn up with all the sudden fame. Pun intended. I think touring and playing live will really take this band/artist to the woodshed and make him better. I really hope he does not get lazy with fame because he has talent and could possibly do things like Meatloaf. Let's wait and see!

Who am I? Am I a christian? What does that mean?  who do I represent?  Ive been so sick, sick inside and sick of being alive  Fame is admonishing  It is exhausting  Is God out there?  If he is than why dont I feel forgiven yet?  I feel lost!  All alone in my own debt that I cannot repay  I dont deserve this thing called salvation  This book you have your people read, does it really do anything!  Im honest? What does it mean to be honest?  Does it mean im a judgemental horrible person or does it make me a hero Do my faults being apparent make me a human  or a monster?   I wondered these same things! But when I started thanking God for everything that has made me who I am, i came to closure and was able to accept salvation!  I started by writing... I am thankful I......  learned to read and write and I thanked God for my mom who made me a reader and a writer and I wrote down all the good and then all the bad! I thanked God because Im still alive and my pain made me who I am and it brought me to a more humble, peaceful place!   Schizophrenia is a curse and then its a blessing cause there are things that happen to your brain when you overthink on everything. Your critical thinking is boosted and you are very humble to the point of breaking in prayer which the bible says   "if my people who are called by my name will humble themeselves and pray and seek my face and turn from their wicked ways then they will hear from heaven and I will heal their land" psalms 86:11-12  Humbling yourself is being honest that your faulty, human and you need help to see the light before your lose your life to a pill bottle and a shot of whiskey in a cup!  I knew a lot about the bible and very little about the power of God! in my teens and 20's I felt stupid and I faught my own disease of pain and I had a hard time until last year I found that Gods healing is an everyday occurence that takes faith and endurance and is full of trials, your life can be revived spontaneously or you can die and slowly come back to a place of freedom again!  As a child I always thought "he can do it for them, he can heal others but hes selective and wont help me" I believed that my whole life, Then I found I was wrong! I found His grace is sufficient and things may not happen when I demand them too but he always comes through! Ive lived through hell fire 10 times! Im still here!

Kuivjfjut
I like how the screaming/growing is transitional to his characters emotional state of mind. Hes sad at first and then his depression channels into explosive rage mirroring in his vocal tones then as he's finally destroyed himself coming back down to that feeling of true regret and sadness with a little rage left. To someone like me who has a hard time with Lorne shore. It really sells the song and my acceptance of the pitch changes . Its a song that bridges the gap of genres and fans and forces you into liking something that you could otherwise find unappealing through emotional projection. I think ronnie is a genius and he should write a rock opera. This is a transformative body of music and elevates ronnie into a rock god instead of a niche hero.

NO FANGS, NO ENTRY https://www.facebook.com/groups/842764886324738/permalink/842767402991153/  This is a Battle of the Bands Group designed to run in a 7 month period or season, starting this June 2021 until December 2021...  Mechanics:  1. Every couple of weeks a randomizer will select from a pool of individual artists.  2. Artists must label themselves according to the duties they would like to perform in the composition of a single. i.e. Vocalist, Guitarist or Sound Engineer  3. The Selection process for 8 teams will be purely random  4. Each couple of weeks will have a theme that the random set of people will work on. i.e. "Ronnie Radke circa 2005", "Romeo and Juliet by Shakespeare", "Anabel Lee by Edgar Alan Poe" etc.  5. Winning songs per couple of weeks will be published in tune core for free. For at least a one year period.  6. Teams are meant to collaborate online only but does permit practicing together in a studio if they prefer. But note that your teammates may be on different parts of the country or even the world.

Ronnie's Bride wakes from an undetermined slumber.  She finds the mansion empty and dusty.  She recalls how Ronnie used to play piano for her and she was blind to who he really was.  Living like a zombie while he murdered innocents. Not seeing the darkness within him while under his influence.  The rumor's surrounding him and his continued coldness to her force her to finally leave. He does not stop her, but mourns losing her after she his gone.  After a period she returns to him to find him feeding. Ronnie realizes that those he loves will be dragged to addiction with him or worse - death.  The Bride too has come her own realization, that he truly is a vampire and this drives her to suicide. Her innocence is lost. Ronnie using his powers saves and turns her. He has turned her to addiction.   The townsfolk finally arrive to seek vengeance for his evil. Ronnie understands the damage he has done and to ensure his bride is not found does not fight back.  Ronnie has lost all hope and is destroyed.  The Bride realizing he is gone and what she has become, has also lost her hope and allows the sun to destroy her as well.

I simply love this song! Ronnieâ€™s doing an amazing job with his singing, whether heâ€™s screaming, belting or whispering. Both the lyrics and the video have a nice bond together since itâ€™s from the same vampire universe, which I really like. I also love how thereâ€™s another message behind the words heâ€™s singing (drug addiction, but correct me if Iâ€™m wrong). Overall, the dark mood, Ronnieâ€™s voice and the theme of this project is breathtaking. I highly recommend you to listen to the whole thing if you havenâ€™t already :)
There's not many songs + music video duos that I can say rewrite the expectations and set new standards for how majorly a band can change. The last song (minus a music video) that changed my perspective on what music could achieve was the "Exogenesis Symphony Pts. 1-3" Muse released in 2009. That song is a masterpiece that redefined what music could do.      This though...the narrative, the characters, the complete rewrite of an old hard rock song to this theatrical, operatic, symphonic legend.....this is next level, seriously upper echelon music theory reconstruction. Having a degree in audio engineering I can attest to how hard it is to reformat a song both in instruments used, rhythm and melody alternated, and tempo changes that coordinate with the key signature. I will get this song into a major film before I die, even if I have to start a GoFundMe just to get there.       In YouTube land, everything is mocked and criticized and satirized and shredded...because that's what PC culture is teaching people. You can't say anything you feel like in public for fear of offending others, so YouTube has become the platform everyone vents their acrimony anonymously. This song and this video though, I have nothing bad to say in the slightest. For the first time in a long, long time. Thank you Epitaph for shelling out the money for decent composers, lyricists, FX people, stunt coordinators, Foley artists, the entire male orchestra in the back, and a storyline as gritty, dark, and haunting as Ronnie Radke is as a person. Legend.

Just heard this track for the first time.  The only other track from this band I am aware of is Popular Monster.  But this track?  Starts as ballad, tells a tragic--nearly operatic--story, using metal vocal intensity, a choir, and poppy, melodies bridged over some damn fine piano playing.  This song is all over the map and my brain is still processing this.  I think I like it though.

Did he just attempt to make an AFI video?
Amazing storytelling. Two different storylines merging together.  One storyline is before Ronnie dies and the second is after.  Whenever she is in the white nightgown it's the present after he is killed by the mob.  The parts with Ronnie are visions she has from the past and is her remembering their life together.  She then realizes she is lonely and can no longer live, not sure if it's beause she misses him or doesn't want to become like him.  I could be wrong but I think when he is burning at the stake and she is burning on the balcony these are not happening simultaneously but Ronnie in the past and her in the present.  Just my take on the narrative after rewatching it a few times.    Also I don't think I can name another song where a singer utilizes this many vocal styles in a single song.  I mean he hits bombastic lows and beautiful highs, he pulls off vibratos and falsettos, the scatting esque part about throwing up, the awesome layered vocal on "Hi my name is Ronnie and I'm addict", the theatrical screeching, both aggressive and melodic screaming(I mean that coda/outro gives me chills every time).  I mean damn, might get flack for this but the first comparison I could think of was Freddie Mercury since they both have voices that mesmerize you.  Just my thoughts

M par Conte Vlad!
So, in case anyone else is wondering what exactly was going on in this video, like I was, here's what I could come up with from watching it a few times and pausing every few seconds. The version of Paige in the white dress is the vampire Paige, living alone in the mansion after Ronnie's death, and she's walking through various rooms and seeing memories of her past self with Ronnie. I think it starts with her in the blue dress watching Ronnie play piano, and everything is good, but then something happens and he kills someone. Maybe the owner of the house/the person the cop later shows him a photo of.  Ronnie buries the body, and maybe Paige doesn't find out about it (since she's calmly sewing as if nothing's wrong). Then the bloodstain on the ground is either from another victim of Ronnie's, or maybe the same one that she has now found out about. She cleans up after him and helps him cover it up, but doesn't look happy about it. I think, based on how relatively calm she still is now, compared with how afraid she is later, we can assume the victim was either someone she didn't care about, or someone who deserved it, maybe. She probably still doesn't know he's a vampire, at this point; she probably just assumes he's a regular person who happens to be a murderer.  Then the police show up with those photos. I think the man in the photo is Ronnie's first victim, but it's hard to say if the woman is also a victim of his, or if Paige is the woman in the photo. The resolution makes it hard to tell, but I'm starting to think maybe it's her in the photo. If this is the case, maybe the man was an abusive husband who Ronnie killed to save her, and that's why she was willing to help him cover it up.  Ronnie denies having seen the man, but maybe Paige is starting to feel guilty for what happened, so they have an argument and she leaves. Ronnie starts drinking and spirals, during her time away, and begins luring other people to his mansion to satiate his thirst for blood. Some time passes, and Paige decides to return, but when she reaches the door, she hears the gunshot. I think the gunshot was probably fired by one of the victims, at Ronnie, in self defence, because what need does a vampire have of a gun?  Paige runs inside and finds the bodies, and Ronnie with glowing eyes and vampire teeth in a woman's neck, and they both freak out. Ronnie runs because he's terrified of her knowing the truth, and Paige is terrified because... well, he's a vampire. She knew he was a killer, but this is different. Ronnie returns to find that she has killed herself (With the knife she was using to cut the thread during the sewing scene, by the way, which is great foreshadowing), but I really can't work out why she did this. Were his latest victims people she cared about, or was she blaming herself for leaving, thinking if she hadn't left he might not have killed those people?  I don't know, but Ronnie clearly doesn't want to lose her, so he gives some of his own blood to save her, right before the mob show up to kill him. Ronnie lets them tie him up and kill him, maybe because he's realised that he's gone from hurting those who deserve it, to hurting innocents, to hurting those he loves, and he doesn't want it to go any further.  After his death, vampire Paige lives for some time, alone in the mansion (as the woman in the white dress), wandering through the rooms and remembering her life with Ronnie, but eventually decides yet again to kill herself, and that is when she walks out onto the balcony in the morning sun to let herself burn. It's unclear whether this is really a suicide, or simply a vampire deciding she's lived long enough, and finally letting herself die. It kind of depends on how much time passed between Ronnie's death and hers, but I think it's the second option. She doesn't seem that sad, more just nostalgic as she watches all the memories throughout the video. Metaphorically, I don't really know what it means, but feel free to let me know what you think. I'm keen to hear other people's interpretations of this amazing piece of art.

Shedding his blood on the cross as a blood atonement for all sins. After dying on the cross, he rose from the dead on the 3rd day and rose to Heaven. To show life after death. To show everlasting life through Jesus's sacrifice. John 14:6 states: "Jesus saith unto him, I am the way, the truth, and the life: no man cometh unto the Father, but by me.". Romans 10:13 states "For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.".      Eternal life in heaven is just one prayer away. Please don't let pride drag you into eternal punishment in Hell, but ask Jesus to give you eternal life in Heaven. He wants you in Hell for all eternity with him. Hell is not a fun place, like worldly people like to imagine. It's everlasting torture with no relief. I'm only taking the time to text this, because I want to get the message out. There are so many distractions in life keeping people from witnessing to other people. Keeping people from thinking about salvation. Keeping you from thinking about life after death. Please, ask Jesus into your hearts to save you of your sins and cleanse you from all unrighteous. Am I the only one that's been a fan of Ronnie since ETF, that still gets blown away by his progress as a musician/vocalist? I obviously thought he sounded good way back then, as he does now, but the screams in this have so much more emotion and weight behind them compared to his previous work. I think the first time, in my opinion at least, that he actually managed to display intense emotion in screams (SCREAMS, not yells/belted notes) was in Popular Monster, and I truly find it incredible that he's able to keep pushing his limits even this deep into his career.  Love him or hate him as a person (the former for me) you GOTTA admit that his evolution as an artist is truly spectacular.
